intro: Cryptantha microcarpa var. stricta, commonly known as the narrow-fruit cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
